snippet: Going from Syria to Turkey to Tel Aviv raises a question of whether there are just three governing options in the Middle East today.
abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column maintains effectiveness of Israel's policy of walling itself off from Middle East has lead to insular Israeli worldview, with far-right political activists growing in power; warns even as Israel has made itself more secure, it has blinded itself to truths it still badly needs to face.
lead_paragraph: Going from Syria to Turkey to Tel Aviv raises a question of whether there are just three governing options in the Middle East today.
